title: Liverpool press conference live updates as Jurgen Klopp speaks ahead of Manchester United clash
text:
Sport Liverpool press conference live updates as Jurgen Klopp speaks ahead of Manchester United clash The Reds sit second in the Premier League table and can make a real statement of intent with a victory at OId Trafford - although United have won their last nine matches in all competitions Share Jurgen Klopp during his press conference (Photo: Liverpool FC via Getty Images) Share 12:54 More from Neville and Carra 
Gary Neville and Jamie Carragher are both expecting Jose Mourinho to send his Manchester United side out with an attacking mindset against Liverpool. 
The two sides last met in mid-October, when an out-of-form United ground out a 0-0 draw at Anfield. 
United’s perceived negative approach to that match led to a drab encounter, but Neville and Carragher aren’t envisaging the same kind of anti-climactic affair being played out at Old Trafford this weekend. 
When you think about how United set up at Anfield, it reflects a particular moment in the season and it wasn’t a good one for United. 
Liverpool were absolutely flying and Mourinho needed to get out of there with something. There’s no way they will be as defensive as they were that day. 
I don’t think it’s the opposite way around on Sunday, but I think Liverpool will have a mindset whereby they see a point as a minimum requirement. They can’t afford to see United cut the gap on them to two points. 
Mourinho will be pragmatic. He’ll know that Liverpool will press high and press hard and he will know that press fades as the game goes on. 
If they can get through the first hour, he will feel that chances and moments will come in the game and Liverpool will make defensive mistakes. (Photo: Getty Images / Eamonn and James Clarke) 12:48 Jim Boardman View from the Kop 
One of football’s biggest battles takes place on Sunday at Old Trafford and, if the visitors can pick up all three points, we might just look back on it as the game that showed Liverpool had finally overtaken their old rivals. 
A win on Sunday would not get Liverpool back in front of Manchester United in terms of league titles won, that’s going to take a while longer yet, but it would show the Anfield side were once more the superior of the two. 
Having spent the past couple of decades trying to catch up to the club that had well and truly been in their shadow throughout the 70s and 80s, the Merseyside club would once more have their old enemy trailing in their wake. 
Liverpool fans growing up in the days when Bob Paisley firmly cemented his side as the Kings of Europe got used to their Reds heroes dominating football, every new season’s team photo adorned with the shining booty from the last one, but that era eventually did what all good things have an annoying habit of doing – it came to an end. Will Henderson and Matip be fit? 
Liverpool boss Jurgen Klopp must make a decision on Jordan Henderson and Joel Matip. 
Henderson has been out since New Year’s Eve while Matip hasn’t played for a month. 
They have both returned to training and Liverpool could certainly do with them at Old Trafford. 
We’ll have the latest from Klopp at around 1pm. (Photo: Liverpool FC/Getty Images) 
Gary Neville believes Manchester United are playing Liverpool at the perfect time. 
Neville’s former club may be sixth in the Premier League, four places below Jurgen Klopp’s side. 
But with United beating Hull City on Tuesday and Liverpool losing to Southampton on Wednesday, Neville thinks an extra day’s rest could be crucial come Sunday. 
Liverpool have almost had the perfect season in terms of preparation, as they have had quite a few free weeks in between matches – but you could argue this has been the most disrupted period they’ve had. 
They’ve played quite a few matches in a short time and have stumbled a little bit; losing to Southampton and drawing with Plymouth and Sunderland. (Photo: Daily Mirror) 12:18 Pogba talks up United vs Liverpool 
Paul Pogba has spoken out about Manchester United’s rivalry with Liverpool ahead of their Premier League clash - dismissing the Man City derby in the process. 
The French midfielder , in the above BBC The Premier League Show video, talks about the history of the game with Liverpool and says he’s desperate for all three points. 
One of the things he picks up on is the special atmosphere, which builds ahead of the clash and is present when the two teams take to the pitch. 
In the same breath he dismisses United’s derby with City, suggesting that for himself and the fans three points against Liverpool means a little bit more. 
The history with Liverpool and Manchester United, it’s a big derby. 
More than Man City, I think because the way you feel the atmosphere - it’s more. 
For me I want to win, I want three points, it’s good to win three points against Stoke City, any team in the league. 
But it’s even better, you have more taste when you win three points against Liverpool because it is a derby. 12:11 
Good afternoon one and all. 
How are we on this fabulous Friday? 
Ready for another blockbuster weekend of Premier League action? 
All eyes are on Old Trafford on Sunday as Manchester United take on Liverpool in a blockbuster showdown. 
Liverpool sit second ahead of this one but have had a frustrating week, first being held by Plymouth before losing at Southampton. 
Jurgen Klopp will expect a response from his players though as they take on Jose Mourinho’s men. 
United have won nine on the spin in all competitions and a 10th will see them close the gap to Liverpool to just two points. 
We will be hearing from the Liverpool boss this afternoon as he provides us with team news and much more. 
Pop the kettle on and get comfy. 
Let’s go!
